author: Joe Queenan
title: When Super Bowl Winners Are Losers
text:
The Philadelphia Eaglesâ€™ appearance in the Super Bowl this Sunday is a mixed blessing for die-hard fans like me. Sure, it would be great if they took home the big trophy, but then what? When long-suffering teams prevail, they immediately cease to be interesting.
It happened with the Red Sox, winless since 1918, when they finally won the World Series in 2004. Before that, there was something noble about their futile struggle against the New York Yankees and the fates. After the Red Sox won, they became just another annoying...
